poem:
"A Watching in the Forest"

In the hushed green of the Irish west
a curse whispers, winding through ancient trees.
A band of bright souls - 
held captive, by ruthless spirits unseen.
Their fear, a mere play for
the forgotten old; an amusement in the deep woods.
In her eyes, a trapped bird echoing their dread -
the world, a haunted stage.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Watched (AKA The Watchers) review – Ishana Shyamalan’s debut shares her father’s talents and flaws A cursed forest in the west of Ireland is the setting for the feature-film-directing debut of Ishana Shyamalan, the daughter of M Night. Dakota Fanning stars as a young American who finds herself trapped, alongside a band of desperate strangers, deep in the woods inhabited by ancient, vengeful entities that view the humans as light entertainment. On the evidence". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
